00055 /* Some simple ghost <-> blender conversions */
00056 static GHOST_TStandardCursor convert_cursor(int curs) 
00057 {
00058     switch (curs) {
00059         default:
00060         case CURSOR_STD:        return GHOST_kStandardCursorDefault;
00061         case CURSOR_FACESEL:    return GHOST_kStandardCursorRightArrow;
00062         case CURSOR_WAIT:       return GHOST_kStandardCursorWait;
00063         case CURSOR_EDIT:       return GHOST_kStandardCursorCrosshair;
00064         case CURSOR_HELP:       
00065 #ifdef __APPLE__
00066             return GHOST_kStandardCursorLeftRight;
00067 #else
00068             return GHOST_kStandardCursorHelp;
00069 #endif
00070         case CURSOR_X_MOVE:     return GHOST_kStandardCursorLeftRight;
00071         case CURSOR_Y_MOVE:     return GHOST_kStandardCursorUpDown;
00072         case CURSOR_PENCIL:     return GHOST_kStandardCursorPencil;
00073         case CURSOR_COPY:       return GHOST_kStandardCursorCopy;
00074     }
00075 }
00076 
00077 static void window_set_custom_cursor(wmWindow *win, unsigned char mask[16][2], 
00078                                      unsigned char bitmap[16][2], int hotx, int hoty)
00079 {
00080     GHOST_SetCustomCursorShape(win->ghostwin, bitmap, mask, hotx, hoty);
00081 }
00082 
00083 static void window_set_custom_cursor_ex(wmWindow *win, BCursor *cursor, int useBig) 
00084 {
00085     if (useBig) {
00086         GHOST_SetCustomCursorShapeEx(win->ghostwin, 
00087                                      (GHOST_TUns8 *)cursor->big_bm, (GHOST_TUns8 *)cursor->big_mask,
00088                                      cursor->big_sizex, cursor->big_sizey,
00089                                      cursor->big_hotx, cursor->big_hoty,
00090                                      cursor->fg_color, cursor->bg_color);
00091     }
00092     else {
00093         GHOST_SetCustomCursorShapeEx(win->ghostwin, 
00094                                      (GHOST_TUns8 *)cursor->small_bm, (GHOST_TUns8 *)cursor->small_mask,
00095                                      cursor->small_sizex, cursor->small_sizey,
00096                                      cursor->small_hotx, cursor->small_hoty,
00097                                      cursor->fg_color, cursor->bg_color);
00098     }
00099 }

00102 /* Cursor Globals */
00103 static BCursor *BlenderCursor[BC_NUMCURSORS]; /*Points to static BCursor Structs */
00104 
00105 void WM_cursor_set(wmWindow *win, int curs)
00106 {
00107 
00108     if (win == NULL) return;  /* Can't set custom cursor before Window init */
00109 
00110     if (curs == CURSOR_NONE) {
00111         GHOST_SetCursorVisibility(win->ghostwin, 0);
00112         return;
00113     }
00114 
00115 #ifdef _WIN32
00116     /* the default win32 cross cursor is barely visible,
00117      * only 1 pixel thick, use another one instead */
00118     if (curs == CURSOR_EDIT)
00119         curs = BC_CROSSCURSOR;
00120 #endif
00121 
00122     GHOST_SetCursorVisibility(win->ghostwin, 1);
00123     
00124     if (curs == CURSOR_STD && win->modalcursor)
00125         curs = win->modalcursor;
00126     
00127     win->cursor = curs;
00128     
00129     /* detect if we use system cursor or Blender cursor */
00130     if (curs >= BC_GHOST_CURSORS) {
00131         GHOST_SetCursorShape(win->ghostwin, convert_cursor(curs));
00132     }
00133     else {
00134         if ((curs < SYSCURSOR) || (curs >= BC_NUMCURSORS)) return;
00135 
00136         if (curs == SYSCURSOR) {  /* System default Cursor */
00137             GHOST_SetCursorShape(win->ghostwin, convert_cursor(CURSOR_STD));
00138         }
00139         else if ( (U.curssize == 0) || (BlenderCursor[curs]->big_bm == NULL) ) {
00140             window_set_custom_cursor_ex(win, BlenderCursor[curs], 0);
00141         }
00142         else {
00143             window_set_custom_cursor_ex(win, BlenderCursor[curs], 1);
00144         }
00145     }
00146 }
00147 
00148 void WM_cursor_modal(wmWindow *win, int val)
00149 {
00150     if (win->lastcursor == 0)
00151         win->lastcursor = win->cursor;
00152     win->modalcursor = val;
00153     WM_cursor_set(win, val);
00154 }
00155 
00156 void WM_cursor_restore(wmWindow *win)
00157 {
00158     win->modalcursor = 0;
00159     if (win->lastcursor)
00160         WM_cursor_set(win, win->lastcursor);
00161     win->lastcursor = 0;
00162 }
00163 
00164 /* to allow usage all over, we do entire WM */
00165 void WM_cursor_wait(int val)
00166 {
00167     if (!G.background) {
00168         wmWindowManager *wm = G.main->wm.first;
00169         wmWindow *win = wm ? wm->windows.first : NULL;
00170         
00171         for (; win; win = win->next) {
00172             if (val) {
00173                 WM_cursor_modal(win, BC_WAITCURSOR);
00174             }
00175             else {
00176                 WM_cursor_restore(win);
00177             }
00178         }
00179     }
00180 }
00181 
00182 void WM_cursor_grab(wmWindow *win, int wrap, int hide, int *bounds)
00183 {
00184     /* Only grab cursor when not running debug.
00185      * It helps not to get a stuck WM when hitting a breakpoint  
00186      * */
00187     GHOST_TGrabCursorMode mode = GHOST_kGrabNormal;
00188 
00189     if (hide) mode = GHOST_kGrabHide;
00190     else if (wrap) mode = GHOST_kGrabWrap;
00191     if ((G.debug & G_DEBUG) == 0) {
00192         if (win && win->ghostwin) {
00193             const GHOST_TabletData *tabletdata = GHOST_GetTabletData(win->ghostwin);
00194             // Note: There is no tabletdata on Windows if no tablet device is connected.
00195             if (!tabletdata)
00196                 GHOST_SetCursorGrab(win->ghostwin, mode, bounds);
00197             else if (tabletdata->Active == GHOST_kTabletModeNone)
00198                 GHOST_SetCursorGrab(win->ghostwin, mode, bounds);
00199 
00200             win->grabcursor = mode;
00201         }
00202     }
00203 }
00204 
00205 void WM_cursor_ungrab(wmWindow *win)
00206 {
00207     if ((G.debug & G_DEBUG) == 0) {
00208         if (win && win->ghostwin) {
00209             GHOST_SetCursorGrab(win->ghostwin, GHOST_kGrabDisable, NULL);
00210             win->grabcursor = GHOST_kGrabDisable;
00211         }
00212     }
00213 }
00214 
00215 /* give it a modal keymap one day? */
00216 int wm_cursor_arrow_move(wmWindow *win, wmEvent *event)
00217 {
00218     if (win && event->val == KM_PRESS) {
00219         
00220         if (event->type == UPARROWKEY) {
00221             WM_cursor_warp(win, event->x, event->y + 1);
00222             return 1;
00223         }
00224         else if (event->type == DOWNARROWKEY) {
00225             WM_cursor_warp(win, event->x, event->y - 1);
00226             return 1;
00227         }
00228         else if (event->type == LEFTARROWKEY) {
00229             WM_cursor_warp(win, event->x - 1, event->y);
00230             return 1;
00231         }
00232         else if (event->type == RIGHTARROWKEY) {
00233             WM_cursor_warp(win, event->x + 1, event->y);
00234             return 1;
00235         }
00236     }
00237     return 0;
00238 }

00241 /* afer this you can call restore too */
00242 void WM_timecursor(wmWindow *win, int nr)
00243 {
00244     /* 10 8x8 digits */
00245     static char number_bitmaps[10][8] = {
00246         {0,  56,  68,  68,  68,  68,  68,  56},
00247         {0,  24,  16,  16,  16,  16,  16,  56},
00248         {0,  60,  66,  32,  16,   8,   4, 126},
00249         {0, 124,  32,  16,  56,  64,  66,  60},
00250         {0,  32,  48,  40,  36, 126,  32,  32},
00251         {0, 124,   4,  60,  64,  64,  68,  56},
00252         {0,  56,   4,   4,  60,  68,  68,  56},
00253         {0, 124,  64,  32,  16,   8,   8,   8},
00254         {0,  60,  66,  66,  60,  66,  66,  60},
00255         {0,  56,  68,  68, 120,  64,  68,  56}
00256     };
00257     unsigned char mask[16][2];
00258     unsigned char bitmap[16][2] = {{0}};
00259     int i, idx;
00260     
00261     if (win->lastcursor == 0)
00262         win->lastcursor = win->cursor;
00263     
00264     memset(&mask, 0xFF, sizeof(mask));
00265     
00266     /* print number bottom right justified */
00267     for (idx = 3; nr && idx >= 0; idx--) {
00268         char *digit = number_bitmaps[nr % 10];
00269         int x = idx % 2;
00270         int y = idx / 2;
00271 
00272         for (i = 0; i < 8; i++)
00273             bitmap[i + y * 8][x] = digit[i];
00274         nr /= 10;
00275     }
00276     
00277     window_set_custom_cursor(win, mask, bitmap, 7, 7);
00278 }
00279 
00280 
00281 /* ******************************************************************
00282  * Custom Cursor Description:
00283  *
00284  * Each bit represents a pixel, so 1 byte = 8 pixels,
00285  * the bytes go Left to Right. Top to bottom
00286  * the bits in a byte go right to left
00287  * (ie;  0x01, 0x80  represents a line of 16 pix with the first and last pix set.)
00288  *
00289  * A 0 in the bitmap = bg_color, a 1 fg_color
00290  * a 0 in the mask   = transparent pix.
00291  *
00292  * Until 32x32 cursors are supported on all platforms, the size of the
00293  * small cursors MUST be 16x16.
00294  *
00295  * Large cursors have a MAXSIZE of 32x32.
00296  *
00297  * Other than that, the specified size of the cursors is just a guideline,
00298  * However, the char array that defines the BM and MASK must be byte aligned.
00299  * ie a 17x17 cursor needs 3 bytes (cols) * 17 bytes (rows)
00300  * (3 bytes = 17 bits rounded up to nearest whole byte).  Pad extra bits
00301  * in mask with 0's.
00302  *
00303  * Setting big_bm=NULL disables the large version of the cursor.
00304  *
00305  * *******************************************************************
00306  *
00307  * There is a nice Python GUI utility that can be used for drawing cursors in
00308  * this format in the Blender source distribution, in
00309  * blender/source/tools/MakeCursor.py . Start it with $ python MakeCursor.py
00310  * It will copy its output to the console when you press 'Do it'.
00311  *
00312  */
00313 
00314 /* Because defining a cursor mixes declarations and executable code
00315  * each cursor needs it's own scoping block or it would be split up
00316  * over several hundred lines of code.  To enforce/document this better
00317  * I define 2 pretty braindead macros so it's obvious what the extra "[]"
00318  * are for */
00319 
00320 #define BEGIN_CURSOR_BLOCK {
00321 #define END_CURSOR_BLOCK   }
00322 
00323 void wm_init_cursor_data(void)
00324 {
00325     /********************** NW_ARROW Cursor **************************/
00326 BEGIN_CURSOR_BLOCK
00327     static char nw_sbm[] = {
00328         0x03,  0x00,  0x05,  0x00,  0x09,  0x00,  0x11,  0x00,
00329         0x21,  0x00,  0x41,  0x00,  0x81,  0x00,  0x01,  0x01,
00330         0x01,  0x02,  0xc1,  0x03,  0x49,  0x00,  0x8d,  0x00,
00331         0x8b,  0x00,  0x10,  0x01,  0x90,  0x01,  0x60,  0x00,
00332     };
00333 
00334     static char nw_smsk[] = {
00335         0x03,  0x00,  0x07,  0x00,  0x0f,  0x00,  0x1f,  0x00,
00336         0x3f,  0x00,  0x7f,  0x00,  0xff,  0x00,  0xff,  0x01,
00337         0xff,  0x03,  0xff,  0x03,  0x7f,  0x00,  0xff,  0x00,
00338         0xfb,  0x00,  0xf0,  0x01,  0xf0,  0x01,  0x60,  0x00,
00339     };
00340 
00341     static BCursor NWArrowCursor = {
00342         /*small*/
00343         nw_sbm, nw_smsk,
00344         16, 16,
00345         6,  7,
00346         /*big*/
00347         NULL, NULL,
00348         32, 32,
00349         15, 15,
00350         /*color*/
00351         BC_BLACK, BC_WHITE
00352     };
00353 
00354     BlenderCursor[BC_NW_ARROWCURSOR] = &NWArrowCursor;
00355 END_CURSOR_BLOCK
00356 
00358 BEGIN_CURSOR_BLOCK
00359     static char ns_sbm[] = {
00360         0x40,  0x01,  0x20,  0x02,  0x10,  0x04,  0x08,  0x08,
00361         0x04,  0x10,  0x3c,  0x1e,  0x20,  0x02,  0x20,  0x02,
00362         0x20,  0x02,  0x20,  0x02,  0x3c,  0x1e,  0x04,  0x10,
00363         0x08,  0x08,  0x10,  0x04,  0x20,  0x02,  0x40,  0x01
00364     };
00365 
00366     static char ns_smsk[] = {
00367         0xc0,  0x01,  0xe0,  0x03,  0xf0,  0x07,  0xf8,  0x0f,
00368         0xfc,  0x1f,  0xfc,  0x1f,  0xe0,  0x03,  0xe0,  0x03,
00369         0xe0,  0x03,  0xe0,  0x03,  0xfc,  0x1f,  0xfc,  0x1f,
00370         0xf8,  0x0f,  0xf0,  0x07,  0xe0,  0x03,  0xc0,  0x01
00371     };
00372

00378         /*big*/
00379         NULL, NULL,
00380         32, 32,
00381         15, 15,
00382         /*color*/
00383         BC_BLACK, BC_WHITE
00384     };
00385 
00386     BlenderCursor[BC_NS_ARROWCURSOR] = &NSArrowCursor;
00387         
00388 END_CURSOR_BLOCK
00389     /********************** EW_ARROW Cursor *************************/
00390 BEGIN_CURSOR_BLOCK
00391     static char ew_sbm[] = {
00392         0x00,  0x00,  0x00,  0x00,  0x10,  0x08,  0x38,  0x1c,
00393         0x2c,  0x34,  0xe6,  0x67,  0x03,  0xc0,  0x01,  0x80,
00394         0x03,  0xc0,  0xe6,  0x67,  0x2c,  0x34,  0x38,  0x1c,
00395         0x10,  0x08,  0x00,  0x00,  0x00,  0x00,  0x00,  0x00,
00396     };

00475     static BCursor WaitCursor = {
00476         /*small*/

00478         16, 16, 
00479         7,  7,
00480         /*big*/
00481         wait_lbm, wait_lmsk,
